Name: Kamaniwanalaya
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
Instructions: SHAKE first 6 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled (cubed ice) tiki mug (or large Collins glass). Top with crushed ice and then top with prosecco.
Review: Try saying the drinks name after a few of these rum laced, tropical pineapple concoctions.
History: Adapted from a tropical drink recipe of unknown origin which appeared in Mark Torre's 1987 book The Bartender's Cherry .
Nutrition: One serving of Kamaniwanalaya contains 335 calories
